Header: Five killed in New Zealand as bus with Chinese tourists rolls over
Content: A bus carrying 27 people, mostly Chinese tourists, rolled over on a highway in New Zealand’s North Island, killing five people and injuring six. New Zealand Police were investigating the accident on State Highway 5 near Rotorua, a popular destination for tourist groups from China, in which the bus flipped to the opposite side of the road. Ethnic liaison officers were coordinating with victims’ families and Chinese officials, said Bay of Plenty Police Inspector, Brent Crowe, who added that police were working with the foreign ministry and the Chinese consulate to notify the next of kin.
